text:
Hey <@UATE4ATHP>.. yes that works..
and we do assign the default value to the new field and HubSpot UI do pick up the value but not rendering :disappointed:
can i see you module's field.json

hi <@UATE4ATHP>
is the snippet of the field, ok?

Hi guys
any way to create a navigation menu like this site: <https://briogeohair.com/>
Some combination of links , images and some badges. I understand that we can code the custom menu in HubSpot.. the worry is more to allowing the site-admin to maintain the navigation on her own.

Wondering if we can make use of the HubSpot navigation editor to manage the input data.. like to pick the images and what badges to show?

In my observation, the HubSpot navigation menu is kind of limiting to do this.

Any idea how to achieve this?
Hmm that all looks good. its probably cuz you already had it on a page, if you change the fields.json they dont always reflect a module that already exist on pages

Does the *Other files* field under *Linked files* in a module not allow you to add files from within the design manager like Stylesheets and JavaScript files does? When I tried adding one (in local dev) the resulting link came up as a 404, but if I add it from a link from the file manager it works.
Yeah can do this easily. But you can't use HubSpot navigation, but you can use a simple menu field in the global module. Basically the same editing experience

true trueâ€¦ are there anyway to get Global module data from API?
we are thinking to share the menu entries with other application
I see.. thanks <@UATE4ATHP> for the info
